news_header: At least six people died after multiple eruptions of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki in eastern Indonesia.
news_text: A series of eruptions at Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki on Flores Island, Indonesia, has resulted in at least six fatalities. The eruptions began just before midnight and continued into the early morning, with ash being spewed up to 2,000 meters into the air. Rescue teams are searching for victims trapped under collapsed homes. The government has declared a state of emergency and raised the volcanic alert level to its highest mark, advising locals and tourists to stay clear of a seven-kilometer radius from the crater due to the risk of lava floods and volcanic ash.
